channel.title: 2 Questions about port fowarding
channel.description:
1. If I have the DUC no-ip to get my server online. do I have the change what the server connect to, to my no-ip address?
Example: DO i have to change it to this?
server = 121.209.***.29
or
server = skaarjpk.servegame.com
???
2. My port forwarding is stuck. I use 43594 but the only way to get it open is to use utorrent and through my router, but when I use utorrent to actually get the port open I cannot connect to my server through my client..?? why?

item.description:
@luna-scape wrote:

Krajix:

I did that and it didn’t work. I still cannot log into my server through my client. the port is open and the server is online.

Sometimes clients have one special ip for playing home so other player can connect but you can’t.

item.title: 2 Questions about port fowarding
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Just change the server sided one (if you can) to your no-ip, change the client one to your ip address. This is how it works:

The source runs the no-ip, the client allows it to only go to your ip address which is running the source, which allows players to log in on your server.
^ Correct me if i’m wrong

Read full topic

item.title: 2 Questions about port fowarding
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Krajix:

[quote]1) you can use your IP address found at whatismyip.com or your no-ip. 121.209.***.29 is an ip address inside your household, so only people on the same network as you could connect.

I did that and it said my IP is 121.209.***.29 | and my no-ip on the DUC is skaarjpk.servegame.com and using DUC is the only way to make it online for me. So I guess all I am asking is what do I change the server side ip to and same with the client. I just tested it all and its not working for some odd reason…

I also use utorrent to open my port because if I don’t use utorrent to open the port. then it wont be open at all. even through accessing my router.[/quote]
Then you are port forwarding wrong…
Also, they need to have the same IP. whether it’s your ip or your no-ip. it needs to be the same.

Read full topic

item.title: 2 Questions about port fowarding
item.dc:creator: @Krajix Krajix
item.description:
@Krajix wrote:

1) you can use your IP address found at whatismyip.com or your no-ip. 121.209.***.29 is an ip address inside your household, so only people on the same network as you could connect.

I did that and it said my IP is 121.209.***.29 | and my no-ip on the DUC is skaarjpk.servegame.com and using DUC is the only way to make it online for me. So I guess all I am asking is what do I change the server side ip to and same with the client. I just tested it all and its not working for some odd reason…

I also use utorrent to open my port because if I don’t use utorrent to open the port. then it wont be open at all. even through accessing my router.

Read full topic

item.title: 2 Questions about port fowarding
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Krajix, post:1, topic:478731”]1. If I have the DUC no-ip to get my server online. do I have the change what the server connect to, to my no-ip address?
Example: DO i have to change it to this?
server = 121.209.***.29
or
server = skaarjpk.servegame.com
???
2. My port forwarding is stuck. I use 43594 but the only way to get it open is to use utorrent and through my router, but when I use utorrent to actually get the port open I cannot connect to my server through my client…?? why?[/quote]

  1. you can use your IP address found at whatismyip.com or your no-ip. 121.209.***.29 is an ip address inside your household, so only people on the same network as you could connect.
  2. Portforward, don’t use uTorrent.

Read full topic

item.title: 2 Questions about port fowarding
item.dc:creator: @luna-scape luna-scape
item.description:
@luna-scape wrote:

Krajix:

Okay thanks but if I don’t want to use no-ip then I cannot get my server online… and are you saying to change my server sided ip to skaarjpk.servegame.com, but leave the client sided to 127.0.0.1? will people still be able to connect?

Dude, u portforward it no utorrent its crap.
U open the DUC from no-ip and change te clientip clientsided in client.java to yourservername.no-ip.biz
Now save and comple and ur done

Read full topic

item.title: 2 Questions about port fowarding
item.dc:creator: @Lirimoo Lirimoo
item.description:
@Lirimoo wrote:

Ofcourse you can connect with uTorrent.
Portforward it with uTorrent.
Close uTorrent , and run the Source and client.
CLOSE IT IN YOUR TABS TOO.

Then Log-IN.
Right when you Logged in , Open uTorrent again , and there we go , its on. ^.^

Read full topic

item.title: 2 Questions about port fowarding
item.dc:creator: @Iyal1234 Iyal1234
item.description:
@Iyal1234 wrote:

hey, if you want to use no-ip you change the server ip to “skaarjpk.servegame.com”
and if you change the client to yourr no-ip you cant connect to your server you need another computer
but you can change it back to 127.0.0.1 and play at it after you have made the client i hope this help if not post.

Read full topic
